profileText: A Representative from Wyoming; born in Wyoming, October 18, 1962; graduated from Lingle-Fort Laramie High School, Lingle, Wyo., 1981; attended Casper College, Casper, Wyo., 1981-1983; B.S., University of Wyoming, Laramie, Wyo., 1986; J.D., University of Wyoming, Laramie, Wyo., 1989; judicial clerk, United States Court of Appeals, Tenth Circuit; lawyer, private practice; adjunct professor, Central Michigan University, Mount Pleasant, Mich.; staff attorney, Wyoming state attorney general’s office; Delegate, Republican National Convention, 2016, 2020; unsuccessful candidate for nomination for Governor of Wyoming in 2018; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress (January 3, 2023-present).
